info.title: API Brasplace Integration
info.description:
Welcome to Brasplace! This API describes how to perform basic integration for creating and updating products, stock, colors, and sizes, as well as how to execute some queries, such as order queries.

**Comprehensive API Documentation**

This documentation provides detailed guidelines and examples to assist you in integrating with the Brasplace API.
You will find information on the various endpoints available, how to authenticate your requests, and best practices for handling errors and responses.

*Refer to the specific sections for more in-depth instructions on managing your products, inventory, and orders efficiently.*

** **

**Environments**

Production Environment - https://integration.brasplace.com.br.

Testing Environment - https://integrationhomol.brasplace.com.br.

** **
**Autentication**

To use the services of this API, it is necessary to request a token and the company_id of the merchant. To obtain this information, please contact us via email at suporte@brasplace.com.br, providing the merchant's CNPJ and indicating in the subject line that you wish to request access to the integration API.

** **
info.x-description:
This documentation provides detailed guidelines and examples to assist you in integrating with the Brasplace API. 
You will find information on the various endpoints available, how to authenticate your requests, and best practices 
for handling errors and responses. Be sure to refer to the specific sections for more in-depth instructions on 
managing your products, inventory, and orders efficiently.

get.description:
Returns stocks within a specified period through pagination, using the provided parameters.

**Example usage:**


```bash curl --request GET \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/stocks/company/{company_id}?startDate=2020-07-07 21:00:00&endDate=2024-08-21 21:00:00&page=10&perpage=15" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

parameters.name: perpage 15
parameters.description: max number of records to return

get.description:
Returns the stock details using its ID.

**Example usage:**

```bash curl --request GET \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/stocks/company/{company_id}/sock/{sock_id}" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

patch.description:
Receives a list of stocks and updates the database with the received quantities.

**Example usage:**


```bash curl --request Putch \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/socks/company/{company_id}" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

--header "Content-Type:application/json" \

--data '{ "stocks":[
{ "sku":"5700601002", "quantity":10 },
{ "sku":"5700601003", "quantity":20 },
{ "sku":"5701502601", "quantity":15 },
{ "sku":"5701502702", "quantity":5 },
]}'

get.description:
Returns products within a specified period through pagination, using the provided parameters.

**Example usage:**


```bash curl --request GET \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/products/company/{company_id}?startDate=2020-07-07 21:00:00&endDate=2024-08-21 21:00:00&page=10&perpage=15" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

parameters.name: perpage 15
parameters.description: max number of records to return

get.description:
Returns the product details using its ID.

**Example usage:**

```bash curl --request GET \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/products/company/{company_id}/product/{product_id}" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

put.description:
Create and edit products - Prepared to accept a list or a single product. Used for both create and update operations.

**Example usage:**


```bash curl --request Putch \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/products/company/{company_id}" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

--header "Content-Type:application/json" \

--data '{
"products":[

"brand":"Other Girls",
"categories":[
"vestido"
], "code":"57026",

post.description:
Create and update images by associating the images with the product.

**Example usage:**


```bash curl --request Putch \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/products/company/{company_id}/product/{product_id}/images" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

--header "Content-Type:application/json" \

--data '{"images":[{"order":1,"url":"https://xxxx/wwww/imagem-57049-pink-1.jpg"},{"order":2,"url":"https://https://xxxx/wwww/imagem-57049-pink-2.jpg"}]}'

Create and update images by associating the images with the product.

**Example usage:**


```bash curl --request Putch \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/products/company/{company_id}/product/{product_id}/color/{color}/images" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

--header "Content-Type:application/json" \

--data '{"images":[{"order":1,"url":"https://xxxx/wwww/imagem-57049-pink-1.jpg"},{"order":2,"url":"https://https://xxxx/wwww/imagem-57049-pink-2.jpg"}]}'

delete.description:
Delete the product imagem using its image name.

**Example usage:**

```bash curl --request GET \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/products/company/{company_id}/product/{product_id}image/{image_name}" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

Delete all images of a specific product.

**Example usage:**

```bash curl --request GET \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/products/company/{company_id}/product/{product_id}" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

get.description:
Returns orders within a specified period through pagination, using the provided parameters.

**Example usage:**


```bash curl --request GET \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/orders/company/{company_id}?startDate=2020-07-07 21:00:00&endDate=2024-08-21 21:00:00&page=10&perpage=15" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

parameters.name: perpage 15
parameters.description: max number of records to return

get.description:
Returns the order details using its ID.

**Example usage:**

```bash curl --request GET \

--url "https://integration.brasplace.com.br/v1/orders/company/{company_id}/ordernumber/{product_id}" \

--header "Authorization:Bearer your_actual_token" \

categories.description: Categories to which the product belongs.

promotion.description: Indicates if the product is on promotion.

updated_at.description: Date of the last order update.

cep.description: Postal code of the delivery address.

street_number.description: Street number of the delivery address.

bus_plate.description: Bus license plate used for transportation.

phone_transp.description: Phone number of the transportation company.

pick_up_in_store.description: Indicates if pickup will be done in-store.

updated_at.description: Date of the last order update.

received.description: Indicates whether the order has been received.

released.description: Indicates whether the order has been released.

separation.description: Indicates whether the order is being separated.

separated.description: Indicates whether the order has been separated.

canceled.description: Indicates whether the order has been canceled.

paid.description: Indicates whether the order has been paid.

sent.description: Indicates whether the order has been sent.

cep.description: ZIP code of the delivery address.

reference.description: Reference point of the delivery address.

promotion.description: Indicates whether the product is on promotion.

is_paid.description: Indicates whether the payment has been made.

additional_values.description: Additional values applied to the order.

from.description: Number of the first item on the page.

to.description: Number of the last item on the page.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

StatusCode.description: HTTP status code of the response.
